what is the shortcut to find and replace again? I always forget it.

I had suggested this in the past but I would love it if the old shortcut trick worked (cmd+f twice pulls up find and replace) it was easy to remember

Agree with <@U7SL518D6> the double cmd+f was my go to and I miss it dearly... I find myself just copying my entire code-base out into sublime text at this point, finding/replacing, then re-copy/pasting back in
been there and done that a few times
Hey Jon, sorry for the late response. On a mac it’s `Option + Command + F`
(which is the same as Sublime Text)

On the subject of search, it would be nice if search kept its value when you unfocused it. Right now search disappears instantly when the field loses focus, which would be fine except you also lose whatever you were searching for. Pretty annoying, since I often will want to search for the same thing multiple times in a row and every time I click away I have to retype it.

I think the old design manager would bring up your last search, but it would be highlighted so if you just typed you'd do another search, but you could also easily search the same thing again. That was pretty good.
I tried searching and didn't find anything related: Is there a way to look for recently edited files without having to close all open windows?
A file, which can't be shown because your team is past the free storage limit, was commented on.
Next related question! Is there a reason it wouldn't show files that were last worked on? I'm the only one making changes today and latest it is showing are from back on May 1st?

Hello everyone, color picker in the design manager gives two values : HEX (#000) and OPACITY (1). 

*Do you know if it’s possible to convert HEX value to RGB value in order to use it like this : rgba(0,0,0,1) ?*
